page.title: 03STEPPING HILL MATERNITY UNIT
page.content: Stepping Hill Maternity Hospital has been on its present site since September 1971. The building consists of 6 floors, 5 of them devoted to obstetrics and 1 to gynaecology. The ground floor houses the ante-natal offices,reception area and midwifery school. On the first floor there is a delivery suite, operating theatre and special care baby unit with facilities for 22 babies. The 2nd to 5th floors have 25 beds each, 83 for consultants' patients and 17 for G.P. patients. The 6th floor houses a scanning unit for checking the development of the unborn child. 3600 babies are born annually and 16500 patients attend the hospital cared for by a staff including 250 midwives.
